answers.answer: Hi!The hands could be cold and finger tips numb due to reduced blood supply as in diabetes, carpal tunnel syndrome, chronic fatigue syndrome, poor sleep, smoking, Vit B12 deficiency, sever anemia, Raynaud’s phenomenon and pinched cervical spinal nerve.Since I cannot examine you and know other related conditions you may be having, nor is a detailed history possible on net, I have listed the various possibilities that should be looked into. Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral. Take care!

question: the tip of my fingers go numb sometimes and for the most part my hands are always cold. What could be the cause of this?
title: poor circulation
